metadata.title: CVE-2022-2294 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 103.0.5060.114allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2294` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.6-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
